intro: Seruneum subvelutinum, commonly known as the velvetleaf seruneum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Seruneum subvelutinum is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
